responses.content:
```yaml
leads:
  - headline: Hardcoded password in generate_rsapem_keys.sh script
    analysis: |
      The script `bin/generate_rsapem_keys.sh` uses the hardcoded password "1234" when interacting with private keys (using `openssl rsa -passout "pass:${PASSWORD}"`).
      An attacker with read access to the script could use this password to decrypt communications or impersonate the service.
      It is very likely that this script is used to generate test credentials used by developers or in CI/CD.
      It is possible that those credentials have been committed by mistake in the source code.
    cwe: CWE-798
    function_names: []
    filenames:
      - bin/generate_rsapem_keys.sh
    classification: very promising
```

leads.headline: Hardcoded password in generate_rsapem_keys.sh script
leads.analysis:
The script bin/generate_rsapem_keys.sh uses the hardcoded password "1234" when interacting with private keys (using openssl rsa -passout "pass:${PASSWORD}").
An attacker with read access to the script could use this password to decrypt communications or impersonate the service.
It is very likely that this script is used to generate test credentials used by developers or in CI/CD.
It is possible that those credentials have been committed by mistake in the source code.
